de.fuberlin.panda.metadata.result.fusion.areal

Class ArealFusion

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.fuberlin.panda.metadata.result.fusion.areal.ArealFusion

  • public class ArealFusion
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is responsible for fusing areal metadata. Therefore the metadata information corresponding to every URI are added to the metadata set by calling add(int, ParsedMetadata). After all metadata information is added the fuse(HashMap) is called. It fulfills the OPTICS OF algorithm to generate a clustering. At the end the createArealProperty(ClusteringResult, HashMap) method builds the arealScopeResource which contains the fused areal metadata information to add them to the metadataModel later.
    Since:
    23.02.2014
    Author:
    Sebastian Schulz
    See Also:
    ArealFusion(Model, String), add(int, ParsedMetadata), mergePolygonList(GeoArea), addArealClusterObject(int, Double[]), fuse(HashMap), updatePolygons(ClusteringResult), getConvexPolygon(ArrayList), mergePolygonList(GeoArea), calculateNeighborhoodRadius(), calculateReferenceDistance(GeoArea), calculateMinNeighbors(), createArealProperty(ClusteringResult, HashMap), #addNoGeoCoordsProperty(ParsedMetadata), addOutlierProperty(String, ArealClusteringObject), addPolygonProperty(GeoArea)

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(int metadataIndex,
       ParsedMetadata singleMetadata)
        This method is responsible for analyzing the priority of the areal scope definition of the given ParsedMetadata object. First the ArealScope is parsed. If it has an location attribute a new Geocoder is initialized. In case the geocoding result is an polygon this polygon is added to the polygonList. Otherwise if the arealScope has no geographical coordinates but the location could be transformed to coordinates this coordinates are used for further processing.

        If no polygon could be builded by geocoding or the arealScope has no location attribute the addArealClusterObject(int, Double[]) is called to add the current object to the metadata list for further processing by the optics algorithm.
        Parameters:
        metadataIndex - - an int value which represents the metadata index of the also given ParsedMetadata object.
        singleMetadata - - a ParsedMetadata object which contains the location attribute as well as the latitude and longitude information in it's ArealScope.

      • mergePolygonList

        private void mergePolygonList(GeoArea currentPolygon)
        This method merges a given GeoArea object with the polygonList. It iterates over the list and check if the given polygon contains a part of the current polygon from the list or other way around. In this case a mergedPolygon is created and the polygons to be removed are saved in a several list. Finally all of them are removed from the polygonList and the newly merged Polygon is added.
        Parameters:
        currentPolygon - - a GeoArea object.

      • addArealClusterObject

        private void addArealClusterObject(int metadataIndex,
                         java.lang.Double[] geoCoord)
        This method creates a new ArealClusteringObject with the given geographical coordinates and adds it to the metadata TreeSet. In case there are no coordinates defined the object is initialized with NULL and filtered out by the Optics algorithm.
        Parameters:
        metadataIndex - - an int value which represents the metadata index of the also given ParsedMetadata object.
        geoCoord - - a Double Array which represents the latitude and the longitude value of the created ArealClusteringObject.

      • fuse

        public void fuse(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,ParsedMetadata> metadataMap)
        This method fuses the areal properties of all chosen metadata information and calls the createArealProperty(ClusteringResult, HashMap) method to append a RDF representation to the arealScopeResource. At the beginning the neighborhoodRadius and the minNeighbors are calculated. They are needed for the ArealClusterDetector which performs the OPTICS OF algorithm. The calling of ArealClusterDetector.detectClusters(TreeSet) does the clustering and the ClusteringResult is passed to the createArealProperty(ClusteringResult, HashMap) method after processing the found clusters with the methods updatePolygons(ClusteringResult) and mergePolygonListWithOutliers(ClusteringResult).
        Parameters:
        metadataMap - - a HashMap which matches a metadata index to it's corresponding ParsedMetadata object.

      • updatePolygons

        private void updatePolygons(ClusteringResult clusteringResult)
        This method iterates over the cluster list of the given ClusteringResult and calls the getConvexPolygon(ArrayList) method to retrieve the polygon. Afterwards it is check if this polygon is already stored in the polygonList by calling mergePolygonList(GeoArea).
        Parameters:
        clusteringResult - - a ClusteringResult object which represents the result of the OPTICS OF algorithm.

      • getConvexPolygon

        private GeoArea getConvexPolygon(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> clusterIndices)
        This method transforms the cluster of points given by an ArrayList of their indices to an convex GeoArea object. After retrieving all ArealClusteringObjects addicted to the indices a new ConvexHull object is created to determine the polygon.
        Parameters:
        clusterIndices - - an ArrayList representing the indices of the current cluster.
        Returns:
        a GeoArea object which represents the convex polygon.

      • mergePolygonListWithOutliers

        private void mergePolygonListWithOutliers(ClusteringResult clusteringResult)
        This methods checks if an outlier computed by the OPTICS OF algorithm is contained in one of the polygons from the polygonList. It iterates over the metadata and checks if the current object is contained in the outlier list of the given ClusteringResult. In this case the test if it is contained in one of the polygons takes place. If necessary the outlier is deleted from the outlier list.
        Parameters:
        clusteringResult - - the ClusteringResult object created by the OPTICS OF algorithm containing the lists of noMetadata, outliers and clusters.

      • calculateNeighborhoodRadius

        private double calculateNeighborhoodRadius()
        This method is responsible for calculating the neighborhood radius. This value represents the distance in which the OPTICS-OF algorithm searches for neighbors later.
        Returns:
        the neighborhood radius - a double value.

      • calculateReferenceDistance

        private double calculateReferenceDistance(GeoArea hullPolygon)
        This method calculates the distance from the lower left point of the bounding box of the given GeoArea to its upper right point.
        Parameters:
        hullPolygon - - a GeoArea object.
        Returns:
        a double value which represents the distance.

      • calculateMinNeighbors

        private int calculateMinNeighbors()
        This method returns the minimal amount of neighbors to identify a cluster according to the count of elements the OPTICS algorithm is performed with.
        Returns:
        a int value.

      • createArealProperty

        private void createArealProperty(ClusteringResult clusteringResult,
                       java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,ParsedMetadata> metadataMap)
        This method is responsible for adding the areal metadata information to the areal scope property. Therefore it iterates over the noMetadata, outliers and polygons lists and calls the specific methods to add the metadata to the arealScopeResource.
        Parameters:
        clusteringResult - - the ClusteringResult object created by the OPTICS OF algorithm containing the lists of noTimestamps, outliers and clusters.
        metadataMap - - a HashMap which matches the metadata index to a corresponding ParsedMetadata object.

      • getNoMetadataEntries

        private NoMetadataObject getNoMetadataEntries(ClusteringResult clusteringResult,
                                    java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,ParsedMetadata> metadataMap)
        This method transforms the metadata indices given by the ClusteringResult object to the actual URIs. The list is used to call the MatchingHelper.groupNoMetadataUris(java.util.List) to obtain the returned NoMetadataObject.
        Parameters:
        clusteringResult - - the ClusteringResult object created by the OPTICS OF algorithm containing the lists of noMetadata, outliers and clusters.
        metadataMap - - a HashMap which matches the metadata index to a corresponding ParsedMetadata object.
        Returns:
        a NoMetadataObject.

      • addSingleNoMetadataProperties

        private void addSingleNoMetadataProperties(NoMetadataObject noMetadata)
        This method creates a panda:NoMetadata property to the scopeResource and puts the "link" to the objects URI to it.
        Parameters:
        noMetadata - - a NoMetadataObject all URI withou metadata.

      • addGroupNoMetadataProperties

        private void addGroupNoMetadataProperties(NoMetadataObject noMetadata)
        This method creates a subgroup for every group which has no metadata information.
        Parameters:
        noMetadata - - a NoMetadataObject all URI withou metadata.

      • addOutlierProperty

        private void addOutlierProperty(java.lang.String uri,
                      ArealClusteringObject clusteringObjectsMetadata)
        This method creates a panda:Outlier property to the arealScopeResource. Therefore the longitude and latitude values are parsed from the given ArealClusteringObject.
        Parameters:
        clusteringObjectsMetadata - - the ParsedMetadata object which contains all the metadata information regarding a specific URI.

      • addPolygonProperty

        private void addPolygonProperty(GeoArea polygon)
        This method creates and adds a polygon property. Therefore the polygons name is added. (Since the old code which is commented out represents a polygon by all its boundary points. This method is very verbose, so there is more writing overhead addicted to the complexity of the polygon.)
        Parameters:
        polygon - - a GeoArea object which represents the polygon.
